name: Central African Republic
currentCrisisSummary:
The Central African Republic (CAR) endures protracted **state collapse**, driven by **sectarian conflict**, **regional meddling**, a **predatory state structure** inherited from **colonialism**, and systematic **resource extraction**. Government authority is negligible, with much of the country controlled by armed groups (notably S√©l√©ka and anti-balaka factions) and **foreign mercenaries**.

This power vacuum is a legacy of a **neo-colonial model** where external powers (France, regional neighbours, now Russia) cultivate clients for resource access. The current phase involves reliance on **Russian private military contractors** (Africa Corps/Wagner) providing regime security for **mining concessions**. This **mercenary-driven extraction** perpetuates violence, displacement, and siphons wealth, inflicting extreme suffering.

colonialRoot.legacy:
**French colonial rule** was brutal and **extractive**. The territory was leased to private **concessionary companies** using **forced labour**. This established the state as an instrument of **violent resource extraction**.

This structure persisted post-independence as France handed power to compliant elites. The legacy is a chronically weak, illegitimate state where **resource control** drives conflict.

historicalContext.title: Post-Colonial French Intervention
historicalContext.description: Post-1960, CAR remained an outpost of ***Fran√ßafrique***‚Äîa system of **neo-colonial control**. France repeatedly intervened militarily to install/depose client rulers (like Bokassa) to safeguard interests (**uranium**). This persistent **interference** prevented sovereignty and entrenched dependency.

historicalContext.title: Debt and Structural Adjustment
historicalContext.description: Following misrule, CAR became heavily indebted, falling under **IMF**/**World Bank** control. **Structural Adjustment Programmes (SAPs)** in the 1990s mandated **privatisation** and severe **austerity**, dismantling public services. This **neoliberal shock therapy** weakened the state, deepened poverty, entrenched **aid reliance**, creating a vacuum for armed groups.

historicalContext.title: Regional Interference (Chad & Sudan)
historicalContext.description: CAR's instability is chronically amplified by its neighbours. **Chad**, particularly under Idriss D√©by, has historically acted as a **regional kingmaker**, invading, sponsoring client militias, and installing presidents (including S√©l√©ka leaders) to secure its southern border. **Sudan** has also provided safe haven and support for armed groups operating in CAR's north, turning the country into a **proxy battleground** for regional power struggles.

historicalContext.title: Sectarianism and the Resource Curse
historicalContext.description: CAR's mineral wealth is a **resource curse**, fuelling conflict. This was **instrumentalised along sectarian lines** in the 2013-present war, pitting the predominantly Muslim **S√©l√©ka** coalition against **anti-balaka** militias. Both groups used violence to capture **diamond and gold mines**, enriching warlords and their foreign partners and embedding the **sectarian divide** within the **predatory economy**.

historicalContext.title: Proxy Battleground and Mercenary Economy
historicalContext.description: CAR is a theatre for **geopolitical competition** (France vs. Russia). The turn to **Wagner Group/Africa Corps** shifts **imperial patrons**. This model trades **mineral rights for mercenary services**, bypassing state-building. It creates a parallel economy of violence and **extraction**, where **Russian mercenaries** operate with **impunity**, committing abuses.

historicalContext.title: International Law and Accountability
historicalContext.description: Despite a **UN mission (MINUSCA)** (marred by sexual abuse allegations) and a **Special Criminal Court (SCC)**, **accountability** is elusive. The **ICC** investigates. Mechanisms are under-resourced, politically constrained, unable to address powerful actors (**foreign mercenaries** enjoying **de facto immunity**). Justice is undermined by focusing on local groups while foreign entities profiting from **illicit resource trade** face no scrutiny.

humanitarianImpact.title: Casualties
humanitarianImpact.description: Thousands killed since 2013 in brutal **sectarian violence** and the **conflict over resources and state control.**

humanitarianImpact.title: Affected Population
humanitarianImpact.description: Approx. 2.8 million require aid due to **state collapse** and unending war.

humanitarianImpact.title: Food Insecurity
humanitarianImpact.description: Over 2 million face acute hunger, driven by **conflict-induced displacement** and livelihood destruction.

humanitarianImpact.title: Displacement
humanitarianImpact.description: Over 500,000 internally displaced by **sectarian cleansing**, **violence linked to resource grabs**, and instability.

humanitarianImpact.title: Refugees
humanitarianImpact.description: Over 750,000 refugees forced abroad by persistent **sectarian violence** and **state collapse**.

humanitarianImpact.title: Healthcare Collapse
humanitarianImpact.description: Healthcare system near collapse due to **state failure** and underinvestment. Life expectancy among lowest globally.

humanitarianImpact.title: Lack of Water Access
humanitarianImpact.description: Millions lack safe water/sanitation due to infrastructure disintegration caused by **conflict** and **state neglect**.

timeline.event: **French Conquest**: In the imperial 'Scramble for Africa', and competing directly with King Leopold's brutal Congo Free State, France conquers the territory. It is named Ubangi-Shari and its colonisation is driven by the pursuit of ivory and the potential for rubber, establishing the legal and military basis for a system of pure extraction.
**Red Rubber Regime**: French concessionary companies impose a reign of terror, using forced labour and extreme violence to extract rubber, resulting in a massive depopulation of the territory.
**Nominal Independence**: France grants independence but maintains deep military, political, and economic control through the 'Fran√ßafrique' system.

**Bokassa's Empire**: Jean-B√©del Bokassa, initially backed by France, rules as a brutal dictator and later self-proclaimed emperor. He is ultimately removed by a French military operation when his utility wanes.

**Decade of Decay**: The state, crippled by debt, is forced to implement IMF-led Structural Adjustment Programmes (SAPs). The resulting austerity triggers army mutinies and deepens the state's collapse, setting the stage for the civil wars of the 21st century.

**S√©l√©ka Coup**: The S√©l√©ka, a predominantly Muslim coalition of rebel groups from the marginalised north (with support from Chad and Sudan), captures the capital, Bangui. The coup triggers the formation of 'anti-balaka' militias, plunging the country into widespread sectarian violence.

**Op√©ration Sangaris**: France intervenes militarily, followed by the deployment of a UN peacekeeping force (MINUSCA). The intervention contains the worst of the violence but fails to address the root causes of the conflict.

**Enter Wagner**: The CAR government, seeking to break its dependency on the West, invites the Russian private military company Wagner Group to provide security and training in exchange for untaxed mining concessions.

**Mercenary State**: Wagner forces become integral to the regime's survival, fighting rebels and securing key mining sites. Widespread, credible reports document their involvement in massacres, torture, and looting, solidifying a new neo-colonial model of resource-for-security.

donate.description: Provides safe spaces, education, and psychosocial support to children affected by the armed conflict, helping them recover from trauma.

advocacy.title: Sanction Mercenaries & Profiteers
advocacy.description: Demand sanctions on foreign corporations and individuals, including those affiliated with the Africa Corps/Wagner Group, involved in the illicit trade of CAR's 'blood diamonds' and gold.

advocacy.title: Oppose Foreign Interference
advocacy.description: Oppose all forms of foreign military interference, whether state armies or private mercenaries, that serves to extract resources and prop up illegitimate regimes.

advocacy.title: Cancel Odious Debt
advocacy.description: Call for the unconditional cancellation of CAR's external debt, which serves to perpetuate dependency and divert state funds away from essential services.

advocacy.title: Amplify Local Voices
advocacy.description: Support and amplify the voices of Central African civil society organisations working on peacebuilding, human rights, and good governance.

advocacy.title: Support Local & International Justice
advocacy.description: Advocate for strengthening the Special Criminal Court (SCC) and other justice mechanisms to prosecute all perpetrators of war crimes, including foreign actors.

reading.title: *King Leopold's Ghost: A Story of Greed, Terror, and Heroism in Colonial Africa*
reading.description: Adam Hochschild's account of Belgian colonial terror in Congo, vital context for the similar brutality of French concessionary rule in neighbouring CAR.

reading.title: *The New Scramble for Africa*
reading.description: P√°draig Carmody analyses the renewed strategic competition over Africa's resources, explaining the roles of Western powers and new actors like Russia.
